storyArc.title: Young Wolves
storyArc.description:
# Young Wolves
In June of 3057, tension between the Wolf and Jade Falcon clans led to the outbreak of the Refusal War. Khan Elias Crichell of Clan Jade Falcon fought the war to destroy his most powerful rival to power. IlKhan Ulric Kerensky fought the war to weaken the fighting capability of the Crusader movement and thus delay the resumption of the drive to Terra. Far more than just a simple Trial of Refusal, the Refusal War at some point involved virtually the entire Touman of both clans and would lead directly or indirectly to the death of four Khans and the death, rebirth and sundering of one clan. The war's implications would ripple out far from the original belligerents to effect the balance of power in the Inner Sphere for a generation.
This is the story of a Trinary of young Wolf warriors eager to write their own line in the Remembrance through glory and sacrifice. The Refusal War will test their resolve, skill, and, most importantly, their loyalty.
## Story Arc details
This is a story arc in active development. Try at your own risk!

storyPoint.name: create_main_char
storyPoint.instructions: Use this form to create a new Clan Wolf mechwarrior for the story arc. You have a pool of XP that you can use to buy skills and special abilities. Any leftover XP will be added to your character.

storyPoint.name: choice_khan_greet
storyPoint.title: A Khan's Greeting
storyPoint.question:
*The holovid display in your quarters aboard the dropship orbiting Colmar crackles to life.*
Greetings, @commander. Welcome to Colmar, first of the tombs in which we will bury the Jade Falcons. You have been assigned to my task force for this offensive. Before we get started, let me ask you a simple question. Do you have a problem serving under a Khan older than your generparents' geneparents and tainted by the Inner Sphere?
storyPoint.choice: No, My Khan. I consider it a great honor.
I will do my duty regardless of any personal feelings.
Your khanship is a farce.

storyPoint.name: choice_mathius_disgrace
storyPoint.title: A Disgrace?
storyPoint.question: Did you hear that stravag woman's use of contractions? She is a disgrace to the clan. How dare she call herself a Wolf! She should have died honorably in a solahma unit years ago. Instead she lives on as a testament to the corruption of the Inner Sphere. If she had not placed a moratorium on trials until after this conflict, I would challenge her to a trial of grievance immediately.
storyPoint.choice: You will respect the Khan in my presence.
Do not be a fool. She would dispatch you without scratching her paint job.
I could not agree more.

storyPoint.name: choice_mathius_trial
storyPoint.title: Trial of Refusal
storyPoint.question:
*Mathius steps forward, seething with rage.*
You would dishonor us by fleeing into the Inner Sphere! I will not follow that Spheroid farce of a Khan to live in exile and abjurement from the Clans! I demand a Trial of Refusal!
*Glancing around, you see some of the warriors nod their heads in agreement, while others watch you attentively. Is is clear that you cannot deny Mathius's demand without a mutiny amongst your troops.*
storyPoint.choice: I relish the chance to finally teach you a lesson in humility.
You will have your trial, and then the remainder of my trinary will join with Khan Ward to protect the Inner Sphere from zealots like yourself.
You will have your trial, although I take no joy in what I must do.

storyPoint.name: choice_ulric_natasha_view
storyPoint.title: Sad Tidings
storyPoint.question: It is no secret that you had little respect for Khan Kerensky when this conflict began. I ask you now, after fighting with her and witnessing her sacrifice, what do you think of Khan Natasha Kerensky, the Black Widow?
storyPoint.choice: I agree that she died a warrior's death and earned a place in the Remberance.
She failed in her mission and reaped her reward.

storyPoint.name: choice_ulric_final_battle
storyPoint.title: An Important Decision
storyPoint.question:
My task force departs for Wotan in one hour. There we will teach the Falcons a final lesson, although I do not expect to survive it. The remains of your task force is to join mine for this final battle.
However, perhaps that is not the right path for you and your warriors. As you know, Khan Ward has taken many of our warriors with a Warden view into the Inner Sphere. They will live there in exile, helping to prepare the Spheroids for the end of the Tukayyid Truce.
To live in exile is no easy thing and I would not force you to make such a decision. Yet, I cannot help but feel that you and your young pups have more to give to the cause. So I will give you the choice. Will you come to Wotan with me or will you join Khan Ward in exile?
storyPoint.choice: I choose to fight by your side on Wotan for the honor and glory of Clan Wolf.
I will join Khan Ward and carry on the Warden cause.

storyPoint.name: choice_tayyiba_warden
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.question:
*As you exit the lift into the hangar bay, Star Commander Tayyiba approaches you, looking concerned.*
@commander, I was hoping I might have a word with you. I heard about what is happening with Khan Ward's forces. I wanted to ask...
*She seems to be struggling with her question.*
I wanted ... to ... ask you whether you support the Warden cause?
storyPoint.choice: Yes, the Founder sought for us to protect the Inner Sphere.
I do not know. My time in the Inner Sphere has left me conflicted.
No, these Spheroids have done nothing to deserve what they have. We must teach them a better way to live, by the Founder's word.

storyPoint.name: choice_tayyiba_tukayyid
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.question: Did you serve on Tukayyid, @commanderRank?
storyPoint.choice: Yes, I served with the Thirteenth Wolf Guards, under then-Star Colonel Natasha Kerensky.
Yes, I fought with the Eleventh Wolf Guards. We received much honor for the capture of Skupo, although we paid a heavy price.
Yes, I served in the Silver Keshik, under SaKhan Garth Radick

storyPoint.name: choice_tayyiba_thirteenth
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.question:
*Her eyes widen in surprise.*
You were a member of the Wolf Spiders? So you have served under Natasha Kerensky before?
storyPoint.choice: She led us to victory on Tukayyid. I would follow her to the gates of hell.
She fought like a Spheroid on Tukayyid, without honor.

storyPoint.name: choice_tayyiba_family
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.question:
*She looks you in the eye.*
I have never been the same after that. That family does not deserve what our "holy mission" has given them. When I think of things that are worth dying for in battle, I think not of glory or honor, but that family.
storyPoint.choice: That is what being a Warden is all about. We are to protect families like those, not to punish them. That is why Khan Ward has been sent into the Inner Sphere.
This just demonstrates your weakness, to be so easily swayed by the enemy. I expect you to show more backbone in the future.

storyPoint.name: narr_colmar_sitrep
storyPoint.title: A Khan's Greeting
storyPoint.narrative:
As you know, Ulric organized your ad-hoc trinary mostly from young and idealistic Wolf warriors. Your job is to whip them into a fighting force that can carry on the legacy of Clan Wolf, however this conflict ends. At the moment, I am not assigning you to a cluster but rather keeping you in my back pocket as a reserve force to be used as needed.
I had hoped to keep you in that pocket a little longer, but the dezgra Falcons on Colmar have called in their reserve bid and are pushing through our lines in the Marakaa Valley. I need you to go plug some holes, immediately. Show these young pups what it means to be a warrior of Clan Wolf!

storyPoint.name: narr_colmar_drop
storyPoint.title: Welcome to the LZ!
storyPoint.narrative:
Hello, @commander. I am Star Commander Louisa and I will be commanding your transport Dropship, *Moonhowler*, for this offensive. We are immediately over the LZ and will be coming down hard. Please brace yourself.
*G-forces glue to your seat as you hear the roar of the engines from below. After minutes of sustained pressure, it eases suddenly with an abrupt jolt.*
And that is touchdown. Prepare bays for egress.
*You hear the distant sound of hydraulic motors.*
@commanderRank, we have landed and are ready to dismount your forces. All the information you need is available in the on-board briefing room. Good hunting, @commanderRank!

storyPoint.name: narr_colmar_debrief
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative:
It looks like your pups cut some teeth today, @commanderRank. As you saw, the Falcons are not honoring us with zellbrigen, so I would recommend that you return the favor for the foreseeable future.
I am happy to report that the Falcon presence on Colmar have been eliminated. I will be taking my Wolf Spiders to officially liberate the capital. You should return to your dropship and get busy with repairs. We will travel with Khan Phelan Ward's forces to Sudeten for another round of hunting green birds.

storyPoint.name: narr_colmar_liftoff
storyPoint.title: Back on board
storyPoint.narrative:
Welcome back, @commanderRank. Once you have your mechs secured in their bays, I am ready to boost for orbit. From there, we are headed to Sudeten along with the rest of the joint task force. Hopefully that should give you enough time to deal with any battle damage and injuries.
When you get back on board, Tech Larine said she would like a word.

storyPoint.name: narr_tech_intro
storyPoint.title: Tech Chat
storyPoint.narrative:
Hello, @commander. I am the chief tech on board here. I see you have been out busting up my machines. Do not worry, my team can fix almost anything, so we will get right on it. You can head over to the repair bay to check on our progress.
We have quite a few parts and equipment in storage aboard the ship, but keep in mind that once those supplies are used up, we do not have access to anything more, given wartime shortages. So if you want to make sure you stay in supply, you will want to be sure to salvage whatever isorla you can from your battles. You can always check on our supplies by heading over to the warehouse.
We also have some second-line mechs mothballed in the cargo bay. These mechs can be used to replace units that have been completely destroyed. Just keep in mind it will take some time to pull those units out of mothball so be sure to give me some advance warning.

storyPoint.name: narr_arrive_sudeten
storyPoint.title: Welcome to Sudeten
storyPoint.narrative: Welcome to Sudeten, @commander. I think it is time to let Khan Ward have some fun, quiaff? Unfortunately, that means your services will not be needed here. While Khan Ward rolls up the Falcons on Sudeten, you will travel with me to Baker 3 for our next date with the Falcons. Make sure you're ready to dance.

storyPoint.name: narr_baker3_arrive
storyPoint.title: Welcome to Baker 3
storyPoint.narrative:
Welcome to Baker 3, @commanderRank! At this point, you have already probably heard the rumors about Khan Ward's task force. After smashing the Falcons on Sudeten, his entire task force was diverted at my command to the Inner Sphere where they will help prepare the Spheroids for a resumption of hostilities with our brethren. He brought with him the entire genetic repository of our Clan.
Like every other damn warrior in this Touman, you may have your own opinions about this decision. Frankly, I don't give a damn right now. From an operational point, all it means is that we will not have Khan Ward's forces available to us and so I will need to lean more heavily on my existing forces, including yours. In other words, I hope you got all the dents out of your mechs because I am going to need them shortly.

storyPoint.name: narr_baker3_sitrep
storyPoint.title: Baker 3 Sitrep
storyPoint.narrative: We will be tackling Baker 3 with a two-pronged assault. Most of our forces will distract the Falcons with a straightforward assault. The remaining forces will use the heat of the hot-spring fed waters of the Baker River to march upriver and directly into the Falcon's rear area. I would like you to contribute a Star to each operation. You are welcome to choose which warriors to assign, but we will drop into the LZ in two hours, so get them ready now.

storyPoint.name: narr_baker3_debrief_success
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative: Excellent work, @commander. Our strike into the rear of the Falcon line has thrown them into disarray. The loss of supplies and communications from your successful mission has been particularly notable. It is just mop up work at this point, so I am sending you back to your dropship for repair and resupply.

storyPoint.name: narr_baker3_debrief_failure
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative: I expected better from you, @commander. Happily, despite your failure to achieve the objectives I gave you, our little adventure has been a rousing success. The surprise attack has thrown the Falcons into disarray, and at this point it is mop up work. Since clearly your units must be in dire need of repair to leave the field so hastily, I am sending you back to your dropship for repair and resupply. Think on your failure and do better next time.

storyPoint.name: narr_baker3_liftoff
storyPoint.title: Time for Liftoff
storyPoint.narrative:
Welcome back on board, @commanderRank. From the way the Falcons are folding, I trust that you gave them hell.
I just received a comm that Baker 3 has been secured and we are to begin transit to the jump point. Our next destination is Devin. Please secure all equipment and personnel for liftoff.

storyPoint.name: narr_devin_arrive
storyPoint.title: Welcome to Devin
storyPoint.narrative: We have now arrived at the ball of dust and sand they call Devin. I am going to give the Silver Devils the call up on this one, so you should just stand by in orbit. With luck, we should make short work of the Second Falcon Jaegers stationed on planet.

storyPoint.name: narr_devin_sitep
storyPoint.title: Devin Sitrep
storyPoint.narrative: Well, things have gone pear-shaped down on Devin. It seems the Falcons knew a big storm was coming on and used that to their advantage on the O'Tsung Plain. Our forces are making a fighting withdrawal to their dropships. I need you to make a combat drop near the front lines and hold off the Falcons long enough to evacuate as many of our forces as we can. We are not going to win this one @commander, but we may be able to turn a killing blow into a flesh wound if your young pups have the mettle to see it through.

storyPoint.name: narr_devin_drop
storyPoint.title: Devin Combat Drop
storyPoint.narrative:
We are dropping into a major storm, @commanderRank, so this is going to be a rough landing. Please be sure everything is secured in the hangar bay and we will try to get you down in one piece.
*Shortly after, you are buffeted about in your combat seat from the heavy winds hitting the descending dropship.*
Bring us down tight and steady, pilot! You flip this egg, and you pay for it!
*You can hear the metal struts supporting the hull groan with the pressure. Then suddenly there is a jerk and all is momentarily silent. The bay doors begin to open with a hydraulic whine and you hear the howl of heavy winds from outside as sand is blown across the metal floor of the hangar bay.*
And that is touchdown! You are clear for egress, @commanderRank. Good hunting!

storyPoint.name: narr_arrive_butler
storyPoint.title: Arrival at Butler
storyPoint.narrative: You arrive on Butler, along with the remnants of Khan Natasha Kerensky's task force. Here you are to meet up and join forces with Star Colonel Ulric Kerensky's task force. The conflict for Butler is already over by the time you arrive. You find Ulric surveying the salvage efforts on the still smoking battlefield.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_honor
storyPoint.title: A Khan's Greeting
storyPoint.narrative:
*Khan Kerensky rolls her eyes slightly.*
Kissing my ass is not going to earn you a bloodname, @commanderRank. Still, I appreciate the fact that I have to watch out for one less knife in my back.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_duty
storyPoint.title: A Khan's Greeting
storyPoint.narrative:
*Kerensky gives you a quizzical look.*
Spoken like a true soldier. However, I thought Clan Wolf bred warriors and not soldiers. Who has been tainted by the Inner Sphere now? Nonetheless, perhaps we will have more need of more soldiers if we are to survive what comes.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_farce
storyPoint.title: A Khan's Greeting
storyPoint.narrative:
*Kerensky's lips quirk upward into a slight smile before she barks out a laugh.*
Get in line, @commanderRank. I do appreciate your honesty. If I had more time to deal with you and all the rest of my critics, I might honor you with a proper ass whooping, as they say in the Inner Sphere. As it is, you will have to take a raincheck.

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_intro
storyPoint.title: Sad Tidings
storyPoint.narrative:
I was deeply saddened to hear of Khan Kerensky's death on Twycross. It is, however, some consolation that she met a warrior's end and certainly earned a place in the Remberance.
She spoke highly of your abilities in combat, and I believe it is due in part to you that Twycross did not turn out worse for our forces. For that, you have my respect and gratitude.

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_natasha_warrior
storyPoint.title: The Black Widow Died a Warrior's Death
storyPoint.narrative:
*Ulric gives you a slight nod.*
I am glad to see that this campaign has given you some measure of wisdom. Khan Kerensky's death is truly a great loss for our clan, but we must push on. Her sacrifice will not be the last, I am afraid.
Now, it is time for you to make a choice.

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_natasha_failure
storyPoint.title: The Black Widow Failed
storyPoint.narrative:
*Ulric looks away briefly before fixing you with a steady gaze.*
Stubborn to your Crusader's loyalties until the last. No matter. We need not talk of other's sacrifices when there are so many more that lie ahead of us.
You will join my task force for the final assault on Wotan. It is unlikely that we will survive but we will make them pay for our deaths dearly. I suggest you return to your dropship and prepare your warriors for battle. We lift in an hour.

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_wotan
storyPoint.title: A Decision Made
storyPoint.narrative:
*Ulric regards you for a moment before nodding his assent.*
You are a noble warrior. I might have wished to have you carry on the Warden legacy, but I will not deny you your chance of honor and glory. We lift off for Wotan in an hour. You best prepare your warriors for what is to come.

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_morges
storyPoint.title: A Decision Made
storyPoint.narrative:
*Ulric smiles as if a burden has been released.*
I have no doubt that honor and glory await you in the future, @commander. I rest easier knowing the future is in good hands.
You must travel to Morges where Khan Ward is preparing his forces for the inevitable Jade Falcon attack. Go with honor, @commanderRank.
*Ulric squeezes your shoulder and then walks away.*
*As you turn to watch Ulric go, you see that all the warriors of your trinary are gathered around you in a semi-circle.*

storyPoint.name: narr_mathius_defend_natasha
storyPoint.title: A Disgrace?
storyPoint.narrative:
*Mathius's eyes narrow dangerously.*
Our clan is being corrupted from within by these surat Wardens and yet you would defend her? It is good at least to know where your loyalties lie. Perhaps, when this is all over, a trial of annhiliation will wipe the taint from our ranks.

storyPoint.name: narr_mathius_agree
storyPoint.title: A Disgrace?
storyPoint.narrative: It is good to see that at least some of our warriors respect the old ways, the ways of the Founder. When this is all over, I hope that I can trust you to help me cleanse this rot from within.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_warden_yes
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
*You see her shoulders relax as the tension leaves her body.*
I had hoped you would say so, @commanderRank. I think that is how I feel as well. It was not always how I felt, but something changed for me on Tukayyid.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_warden_dont_know
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
*She nods her head.*
I understand, @commanderRank. I have felt conflicted as well.
I was not always so conflicted. I used to believe that it was our sacred heritage to conquer the Inner Sphere and redeem the work of the Great Father. But then everything changed on Tukayyid.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_warden_no
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
*She drops her head unwilling to meet your eyes.*
I am sorry to hear that you feel this way, @commanderRank. I used to feel like that too. But then something changed for me on Tukayyid.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_eleventh
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative: I know what it feels like to pay those costs. My unit, the Third Battle Cluster, was also devastated on Tukayyid.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_silver_keshik
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative: I also served under Garth Radick's command, in the Third Battle Cluster of Beta Galaxy. He was a charismatic man and I found myself attracted to his Crusader beliefs. Or at least I did when we first touched down on Tukkayid.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_natasha_victory
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
*Tayyiba nods her head vigorously.*
Without Natasha Kerensky and Phelan Ward, I believe tht we would have failed on Tukkayid like so many other clans. They showed us the importance of being flexible and adaptable. Being stuck in one's ways is a recipe for defeat, quiaff? I learned that on Tukkayid, as well, in a more personal way.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_natasha_dezgra
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
*Tayyiba shakes her head.*
But without Natasha Kerensky and Phelan Ward, surely we would have lost! There is no dishonor in learning to adapt to the enemy that one faces. Being stuck in one's ways is a recipe for defeat, quiaff? I learned that on Tukkayid, as well, in a more personal way.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_tukayyid_exp1
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
My unit, the third Battle Cluster was tasked with garrison duty when our forces pulled back to re-supply before the assault on Brzo. We did not expect the Comguards to hit us, but that is exactly what they did. Multiple divisions ambushed us. We were outnumbered three to one. We fought like hell and dished out more than we took, but we were decimated. I blacked out after my second ammo bin popped off.
When I came to, I was lying in the bedroom of a small farmhouse not far from the fighting. Apparently, I had dragged myself several miles from the battlefield before collapsing in an agricultural drainage ditch, although I remember none of it. A local farming family found me and took me in.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_tukayyid_exp2
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
They did not care that I was the enemy. I was a just a person in need of help. They nursed me back to health. They had two children. Their names were Kate and Tynan. They would sit at the foot of my bed and ask me questions about life in the Clans for hours. They were curious, not afraid. When they were not questioning me, they would play games with me to keep me from getting bored. Kate would come in at night with a book so that I could read her a bedtime story.
Eventually, I recovered enough to travel and I was returned to our clan in a prisoner. I cried when I had to leave that family, knowing that I would likely never see them again.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_final_warden
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
I am pleased to hear you say it @commanderRank. I just hope...
*She pauses.*
I just hope that we will have the opportunity to join Khan Ward in the future. It is not that I do not want to do my duty as a warrior, but rather that I would prefer to know what my sacrifice is for.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_final_crusader
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative: I am sorry to hear you say that @commanderRank. You can be assured that I will do my duty as a warrior, regardless.

mission.name: Colmar
mission.desc: Colmar was notable as the first battlefield of the Refusal War. The main fighting occurred in the Marakaa Valley, where the 352 Wolf Assault Cluster used the dry river bed to position themselves advantageously against the defending 12th Falcon Regulars.

mission.name: Baker 3
mission.desc: The lush forests and hot springs of Baker 3's southern continent, Lowa, have made it a recreation and tourism destination in the region for centuries. Khan Kerensky planned to use those same features to her advantage to devastate the defending Jade Falcon forces. While her main forces feinted a direct assault through the heavy forests near the Jade Falcon HQ, her remaining forces would approach the rear area by traveling directly up the Baker River. Because the Baker River was fed by numerous hot springs upriver, it would help mask the heat signatures of these units. Khan Kerensky hoped that a lightning assault on these rear areas would take the fight out of the Falcons.

mission.name: Trial of Refusal
mission.desc: You must face Star Commander Mathius in a Trial of Refusal.

scenario.name: Cutting Teeth
scenario.desc:
While the main body of the 12th Falcon Regulars is bottled up in Bright Basin, a trinary has broken through the main lines and is seeking to circle around and hit the Wolf forces from behind. Khan Kerensky has called in your unit to deal with the situation.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
The 12th Falcon Regulars should request *hegira* if reduced to less than half their original force size while the player has more BV remaining. This can be simulated in MegaMek with the `/victory` command. If the player does not wish to grant *hegira*, then the bot settings for the 12th Falcon Regulars should be changed to RETREAT and they should begin a fighting withdrawal. In either case, the player can claim control of the battlefield for *isorla*.
The player may receive *hegira* from the Falcon forces at any point by using the `/defeat` command in MegaMek. Players granted *hegira* cannot claim control of the battlefield. They can recover downed pilots, but not mechs or salvage.

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy or rout 50% of the following force(s) and unit(s):
Preserve 50% or more of your own forces

scenario.name: Diversion
scenario.desc:
Your goal is to feint an attack against the Jade Falcons to get their forces to commit. You will be heavily outnumbered, so use the heavy woods to your advantage and make yourself a difficult target. To encourage their advance you must bleed their forces a little, before withdrawing with (hopefully) minimal damage.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
Smelling blood, the Jade Falcon units will not grant *hegira*, nor will they ask for it. They will also not retreat. The player can only claim control of the battlefield if they destroy all opposing forces.

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy or rout 10% of the following force(s) and unit(s) within 12 turns:
Preserve 75% or more of your own forces for at least 12 turns before withdrawing.

scenario.name: Hide and Seek
scenario.desc:
After wading up the river bed of the Baker River, you have pulled steaming mechs out along the banks near your target. Your star has been assigned the task of taking out a nearby comm center and supply depot. Taking out any sentry units is an added bonus, but you will likely face heavy reinforcements if you remain in the field too long.
Fortunately, the successful feint attack by the remaining forces has left only a token garrison force and some units are currently shut down and will not immediately enter the combat.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
The Jade Falcon units are defending a critical strategic installation and will not retreat or ask for *hegira* while either building is still functional. Once the buildings are destroyed, the Jade Falcon forces will only attempt to retreat if their remaining BV is 50% or less that of the player's forces after round 12 when all available reinforcements have arrived.

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy the two multi-hex medium buildings in the southeast quadrant of the map.

scenario.name: Hide and Seek
scenario.desc:
After wading up the river bed of the Baker River, you have pulled your steaming mechs out along the banks near your target. Your star has been assigned the task of taking out a nearby comm center and supply depot. Taking out any sentry units is an added bonus, but you will likely face heavy reinforcements if you remain in the field too long.
Unfortunately, the Falons have not been fooled by the feint attack by your remaining forces and so the buildings are defended by a full Nova. Additional reinforcements may arrive if you take too long to meet your objectives.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
The Jade Falcon units are defending a critical strategic installation and will not retreat or ask for *hegira* while either building is still functional. Once the buildings are destroyed, the Jade Falcon forces will only attempt to retreat if their remaining BV is 50% or less that of the player's forces after round 14 when all available reinforcements have arrived.

scenario.name: Trial of Refusal
scenario.desc: It is time to face Star Commander Mathius in a Trial of Refusal. Or at least as soon as the devs figure out how to make that happen. Hold please.
